attributes.action: abolish the effective 82% tax rate on Pension Fund surpluses
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If you have worked hard all your life, been prudent with your pension, and happen to die over the age of 75, and have at that point no financial dependants, the pension fund left over is taxed at 70%, the 30% left over goes into the estate, which if over the Inheritance Tax Threshold, gets taxed at a further 40%, resulting in the composite rate of 82% leaving a miserly 18% for children, grandchildren and other relatives and friends to share in just 18%.

Are you happy leaving 82% of your Pension Fund surplus to the Government?

With house prices continuing to climb this couls affect enormous numbers of people, becoming a tax on prudence  and sound personal financial management.
